From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: orkan, orkán, and ork'an

German

[edit]
German Wikipedia has an article on:
Orkan
Wikipedia de

Etymology

[edit]
Etymology tree
Taíno *hurakābor.
Spanish huracánbor.
Dutch orkaanbor.
German Orkan

    Borrowed from Dutch orkaan, from Spanish huracán, from Taíno *hurakā. Doublet of Hurrikan.

    Pronunciation

    [edit]
    • IPA(key): /ɔʁˈkaːn/, [ɔʁˈkaːn], [ɔɐ̯ˈkaːn]
    • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
    • Hyphenation: Or‧kan
    • Rhymes: -aːn

    Noun

    [edit]

    Orkan m (strong, genitive Orkanes or Orkans, plural Orkane)

    1. (European) hurricane; strong windstorm

    Declension

    [edit]
    Declension of Orkan [masculine, strong]
    singular plural
    indef. def. noun def. noun
    nominative ein der Orkan die Orkane
    genitive eines des Orkanes, Orkans der Orkane
    dative einem dem Orkan, Orkane1 den Orkanen
    accusative einen den Orkan die Orkane

    1Now rare, see notes.

    Related terms

    [edit]
    • Orkanböe
    • Orkantief

    Descendants

    [edit]
    • ⇒ Czech: orkán
    • → Macedonian: оркан (orkan)
    • → Serbo-Croatian:
      • Cyrillic script: о̀рка̄н
      • Latin script: òrkān

    See also

    [edit]
    • Hurrikan

    Further reading

    [edit]

    [edit]

    Proper noun

    [edit]

    Orkan

    1. a male given name
